text:
The alternative interval syntax definition (at, for example, http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/mod_expires.html) uses curly braces and an asterisk, but the meaning of those characters is not explained.  (For example, does asterisk mean "zero or more"?  How is it different from square brackets combined with an ellipsis?)  

The meaning of those characters should be explained either in the mod_expires doc or at http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/directive-dict.html#Syntax, or else the definition of the alternative interval syntax should be changed to conform to http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.3/mod/directive-dict.html#Syntax.
creator: rtrott@gmail.com
